column4: if I remove iptables, it won't be any firewall in my system, right?
if I remove iptables, it won't be any firewall in my system, right?
why would you want to remove iptables... leave it open...
cause I can't connect to anything
: yes I checked, there's no rule in there
and what about the default policies? all ACCEPT?
I removed iptables, but utorrent still doesn't download anything nor it connects to any peer. Port is forwaded right, tracker is working. what's the problem?
anyway, this commands will bypass your firewall: iptables -P INPUT ACCEPT
no more firewall on your system
also you could do: iptables -F; iptables -Z; and iptables -X to erase previous rules
why utorrent don't connect to anyone?
maybe that wasn't your problem, what about you net config? ip, netmask... gateway?
